website_summaries.verdict: Desktop tower-style computer that’s made especially for gamers, but it has plenty of power for all computing tasks.
pros: Huge storage capacity of 1TB in a fast SSD
High-performance eight-core processor delivers excellent speeds
Provides outstanding graphics performance for games or video processing
cons: Pricey unit that probably will be overkill for those who don’t work with videos or play games

customer_reviews.title: Sit down, buckle up, take your hat off, and hang on
customer_reviews.text: Man is this thing Fast. If you were to look at the most powerful new components on the market and then take just 1 step down you have this screaming machine. Why spend another $1500.00 to $3,00.00 just to get a 2% increase, no way man. Well unless you have enough cashola to routinely light your fires with money, which I do not. I'm running 2019 COD Modern Warfare at well over 90 FPS on all Ultra settings, even while having programs running in the background. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. Zier

customer_reviews.title: Great Computer with an Issue I had to Fix Myself
customer_reviews.text: A lot of power in a fairly small package. This computer is a performer. Paired with a good monitor, you'll get an amazing experience. Didn't come with too much bloatware either. Only one disappointment. The water cooler was not installed correctly. There are two screws that hold the unit in place on the front. The back has tabs that should be secured (slotted) in the back of the case - holding the fan/radiator securely in place once the screws are tightened. The tabs on mine were not secured and, as a result, under load there was significant amount of vibration created. Didn't take long to fix but I expect better quality control at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: JRC

customer_reviews.title: Fast and loud
customer_reviews.text: This is a high-performance desktop machine. Core i-9, 32 GB of RAM, a 1 TB SSD and a high-end graphics card make for snappy responsiveness. The only downside so far is that the fans throttle up and the machine gets quite loud when the CPU is at 50%+. The graphics card can get up to 100% usage without an appreciable noise difference from idle. There's space inside for 2 hard drives, in addition to the supplied 1 TB SSD. The design of the case is not conducive to an internal DVD/Blu-Ray drive.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Chang

customer_reviews.title: Poor cooling
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a great deal due to the low price and high-end components. Unfortunately, the poor airflow in the case caused the CPU and GPU to throttle down and limit its performance. I was only playing World of Warcraft also, which is not as demanding as other games (and i limited my frame-rate to 60 and reduced resolution to 2440). I was able to cool the GPU by installing EVGAs software and changing the fan profile (although this caused it to be extremely loud). The CPU however reached excess temperatures of 80-85 degrees Celsius at 55%. Don't waste your time with HP desktops, spend the extra money and buy quality products.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Crashes constantly. No support from HP.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible experience. Computer does not work. Keeps crashing on me. HP support is useless. They kept disconecting from me with no follow up. Each time I tried to contact I would have to start from 0 again and keep getting disconnected. I bought this to not have to deal with building a pc. Paid good money and they sell a broken product with no support. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: MARCELO GONZALEZ

customer_reviews.title: Constantly blue screens
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad that Amazon takes care of their customers. Initiated a HP support ticket through Amazon; the technician at HP requested that I reformat the PC / upgrade drivers etc for a new PC that had issues with Ethernet adapter and blue screening out of the box. When asked "don't you have techs to take care of things like that" they said not right now. Amazon's rep was still on the phone and offered to swap it out with a new unit. Hopefully the new unit works out of box and doesn't blue screen.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Morris

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: Well i should have fallowed the advice of some of the reviews but i thought i ll check it out for myself. Sure enough after letting the computer sit for an hour while it was turned on, blue screen came up. Reset the pc and reinstalled windows, still the same thing. So my suggestions is stay away from this bad omen. Its going back to HP on the first day of use. Or in this case no use out of it at all. It overheated
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Over heated
customer_reviews.text: This thing over heats like crazy just like everything else u see I can’t even play simple games on it it shut down on me after just 10 mins of turning it on and downloading Chrome and steam froze up and shut down and wouldnt start back up
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: Constantly Freezing up
customer_reviews.text: Tried everything to get this computer to work well: updated everything--sat on windows and HP site and updated everything possible. Still it freezes up constantly and is incredibly frustrating. I use this for work so need it up and running always--within 15-20mins it freezes. Ready to throw it out. Wish I did not wait so long or I would of returned it, Looked the issues up and apparently they are well known--once again--wish I would of returned this when I knew it would not get better
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent computer and temp issues easily avoidable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great computer. Playing graphically intensive games at max graphics with gpu temp never exceeding 75 C. Extremely fast as well. The issues people have with overheating are completely avoidable with very simple and easy adjustments. The issue is that the default fan scaling based on GPU temperature is garbage. Download MSI afterburner and set a custom fan scale. I have the fan at around 60-70% at 70 degrees. I also put furniture risers under the legs to lift it up some since their is airflow from the bottom. Do not hesitate to buy this if you are worried about temperature issues.
customer_reviews.author: ANIL K GUPTA

customer_reviews.title: Great product; Horrible airflow
customer_reviews.text: It's fast, and powerful. Definitely worth the money. However, I'd suggest you get a better case. This case comes with no intake! It has one exhaust fan in the back side (very small), and the liquid cooling fan for the CPU. I was editing a 6 minutes 4K video, and it was heating up around 86 degree C. The fan was also spinning very loud. I added another 32 GB of RAM to total up to 64 GB. All in all, it's a great PC with horrible airflow.
customer_reviews.author: ARSP LINK the YouTuber

customer_reviews.title: Problematic HP OMEN - cheap and not working
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend getting this HP, since day 1, I have issues with this Desktop. Bluetooth is not working, does not wake up from sleep mode, heats up like ridiculously and would crash time over time. All drivers/bios are updated. I will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Admiral

customer_reviews.title: Has been a solid gaming PC, can sound like a jet engine when the CPU is under load
customer_reviews.text: About a month in, this has been a solid PC for gaming and is quiet under normal use. When I've tried something like rendering using the CPU and all the fans kick into max it sounds like the PC has a jet engine and is going to take off at any moment. Using the pre-installed OMEN command center I've been able to monitor the PC temperatures and with or without the jet engine fans the PC's temperatures seem to stay in safe territory. In case this review ends up somewhere else, I'm talking about the OMEN with an i9-9900K, 32Gb RAM, RTX 2080 Super(month before RTX 30 series :( ).
customer_reviews.author: Doug B

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Got this in March. Worked great until May and now it’s constant blue-screen errors. Immediately upon startup even in safe mode. It’s a giant paperweight now.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get through booting up
customer_reviews.text: The slot where the graphics card slides into was bent, apparently they don't test the computers before shipping them out. HP doesn't advertise a tech support phone number to call, so you have to go to their website for troubleshooting that didn't help. The computer powered on, but it didn't display anything (not surprising if the graphics card couldn't work), and it didn't register the keyboard to get into the BIOS. I've ordered a replacement; if it works, I might update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware, product is horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: At first it sounded like a wonderful deal knowing nothing about computers, so i asked my friends and on paper it sounded great... The computer overheats constantly and sounds like a jet engine, both my usb ports on the front end of the tower are unusable due to the fact that theyre bent on the inside to prevent a usb from entering, i CONSTSNTLY have to turn it off and let it sit without the side pannel while running a fan next to it because hp was cheap and didnt install the correct cooling system for it.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer S.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding performance, amazing aesthetics and zero cooling issues
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this purchase. Runs like a dream. Try finding similar specs on a pre-built system at this price point. Also the photos don't do the case and LED lighting justice. Zero issues with overheating even after extended play sessions. I did elevate the case about 1.5 inches to facilitate airflow just as a precaution.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of two girls

customer_reviews.title: Really fast, Great power for the price, but a bit noisy with coil whine
customer_reviews.text: Love this PC for the most part. A lot of bang for your buck and it is an aesthetically pleasing tower as well with the customizable lightning, clear case with neatly managed cables inside, and somewhat smaller form factor (for a gaming PC). The only grip I have is with the coil whine. It runs quiet until you use anything that heavily taxes the GPU, then it emits a high-pitched whine that can be a bit annoying. I normally use headphones connected to separate speakers, so I do not notice it a lot, but it could be a deal-breaker for those with sensitive hearing. Overall though, a great deal with just that one issue so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Preece

customer_reviews.title: This machine could be OC easily as it runs seriously cool!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about this machine. If I were to give a bad mark it would only be that the power button it to small in my opinion. The 140 plus frame rates in COD MW are consistent with graphics set to ultra! Recommend this machine for anyone's gaming needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A.

customer_reviews.title: No Linux support
customer_reviews.text: Great Hardware for VR/CV/ML SW development but there is no Linux support and to update BIOS, customer support asks you to install Windows back.
customer_reviews.author: DrCat

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pc build!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great build. This thing is rock solid and runs like a thoroughbred race horse. Boot up times are ridiculous and not once has this pc even sputtered. Not the cheapest thing but if you need a strong pc for graphic and video editing, gaming, etc... I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tara P

customer_reviews.title: i9 Processor speed makes an amazing difference in response of Newest flight simulators.
customer_reviews.text: The processor speed and SDD storage response are amazing. Boot up is quicker, downloads are faster, and response when opening an application is almost immediate. I am quite pleased with this PC. Particularly when I am running X Plane 11 or Microsoft FSX with options set to max.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: powerful computer but has major flaw
customer_reviews.text: this computer is a beast in performance but the lack proper cooling makes the machine run subpar and potentionally shutdown. also if your willing to spend 2k dont waste time on 2080 super just get 3080. for a total newbie this is a very good computer, i would just watch out for the temperatures. it is mandatory to downlod msi afterburner and increase the fan speeds. but if you want a good pc with proper cooling and ventalation i would look else where.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, very well built system
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use this desktop for deep learning / machine learning. The machine was very easy to set up and is very fast. Very well built system. I had some issues with wifi and audio, but updating the drivers solved the issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You will not regret this power house!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this unit for about a week, I’m so happy with this PC. I was reading about overheating however mine is running like a champ and the PC has several fans which has been keeping it cool. I want the Intel I-9 core and the fastest video card possible plus purchased an additional 32 gigs of ram. Once again great pc!! Thank you Darkerknight007.net
customer_reviews.author: Michael Knapp

customer_reviews.title: This pc is a steal if it is on sale.
customer_reviews.text: This pc is amazing. I got it on sale for a really good price and don’t regret it. It dont have heating issues, but the gpu get hotter than i would like. But it is easy to fix if you just download msi after burner and turn up the fan speed. But from my experience, if you turn the fan speed to high. It tends to crash my game. Some games it perform good on is fortnite at a consistent 240 on low settings Csgo at a constant 500fps+ On med settings and rainbox 6 siege pretty smooth. On low to mid.
customer_reviews.author: Khoi Le

customer_reviews.title: Great system for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fine machine. I was in need of a replacement of my Asus PA90 that made it less than a year without frustrating me to the point of giving up on it. Poked around a whole lot and settled on this machine. Not a single issue to date and super happy with the performance, layout of everything, and looks. Great machine.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hackman

customer_reviews.title: Bought two. One works
customer_reviews.text: It lasted beyond the one month return window only because we did not use it until our custom furniture for our new research room was complete and ready for use. One is working fine, but one will not wake up when it sleeps and it intermittently has a fan problem. Not sure where to find any tech support. HP is no help.
customer_reviews.author: F. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Got this as part of Amazon's Thanksgiving/Christmas Purple Tuesday Deals thingies and was very impressed by the bang for the buck. Being as it was the Holidays, I went on a binge and purchased a HyperX Keyboard, Mouse, Headset, and Memory Modules from Amazon. I would say that the only upgrade I really needed was the keyboard and mouse, because the one that is included sucks big time.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great performer but runs hot.
customer_reviews.text: Awsome rig for the price. Cooling is an issue. Ran cod warzone on max settings with display set for my 1080p monitors and it did not skip a beat but reached temps up to 100c. Contacted hp support and they tweaked the bios. It cooled down a little bit (92c) but not where i want it at. What i found interesting is the GPU is fan cooled and ran into the mid 70c under load but the CPU is water cooled and runs hot. If cooling can be resolved, this setup would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Workinonit

customer_reviews.title: Enough but weak CPU cooling, good for casual FPS gaming
customer_reviews.text: Good performance and relatively small size and well managed wiring. Very noisy when playing game because of diameter of the case fans. 1 open M.2 slot and 2 open memory slots for expansion. No PCI express available for expansion (not a problem for me though).
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but has some flaws
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty fast PC but it does get hot. I read a review where someone stated it cools from the bottom up so get it off the floor which was a non issue since my pc is already on a rolling cart with plenty of air space beneath for air flow. Still have to take the cover off and use another fan to cool it down when using it. I like it just wish I would have waited and found a unit with a liquid cooled cpu. USB ports wont recognize RIFTS until you pull it out and move it to another slot. Odd but again I don't use it that often so it's a good pc for me.
customer_reviews.author: JeorgeK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Computer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gaming computer. Started up, connected to the network with no issues, wakes from hibernate within seconds, all games play at ultra settings, very quite. I love this computer!
customer_reviews.author: Bob was here

customer_reviews.title: It runs fast, love the video quality, but once it starts OVERHEATING.....
customer_reviews.text: Everything is fine until the system starts OVERHEATING. It happened when playing games (doesn't matter what type or setting), watching Youtube, or just browsing; yes, it really happened! It gets extremely loud when it overheats, so I'd turn it off to give it time to cool off to avoid system shutdown. Now I leave the side panel open as a temporary resolution, but uncertain if there's a fix to this issue other than a new computer.
customer_reviews.author: TorracAndOtatop

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I was researching different gaming computers for a while, and thought about building one for myself. Then I stumbled across this PC. While I am already a fan of HP, the HP Omen blew me away and I got a great deal! It pairs well with all of the other Omen accessories that HP sells. Omen command center is great and controls everything well. My friends like my rig so much that one of them bought one themselves. The computer runs quiet and stays cool. No problem running any game so far! Definitely recommend this PC and pairing it with other Omen accessories!
customer_reviews.author: Devon Carefoot

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Pre Built Gaming PC
customer_reviews.text: This is my first gaming PC, I bought it while on sale for cyber Monday and I can literally run any game on ultra. I haven’t had any heating issue but i don’t game for 8 hours at a time either. I’m Not super PC smart but my nerd friends all say I picked a great one lol.
customer_reviews.author: clifton

customer_reviews.title: Good Christmas gift)
customer_reviews.text: It was a pleasant surprise, but it goes with keyboard and mouse (not optical). Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Kelva

customer_reviews.title: good pc/with water cooling runs like a beast
customer_reviews.text: good pc has water cooling which is cool plays rainbow six siege at 227 fps with all graphics on extreme overall a very good for its price
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Best PC i have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Got the i9 model a couple weeks ago and so far its fantastic, defiantly the best PC I have ever owned. It will play any game on ultra setting and still have power in reserve. So far I haven't seen any major heating issues that other people have posted about but I don't play many FPS games I mainly play Racing games. for the money this is the best PC you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: trekx

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy it, Dont Be Dumb
customer_reviews.text: Although through the specs this computer looks like a beast, don't be fooled. This pc only comes strapped with ONE case fan in total and one for the CPU, this causes your pc to overheat and throttle with the snap of a finger. Another issue with this is memory. It may say you get 32 gigs of Hyperx Memory but don't be fooled you're getting 32 gigs of the slowest ddr4 ram they make, 2133mhz I believe it was. Just spend the extra buck to get a better, well cooled pc unless you want your pc to throttle every time you do something ever so slightly demanindg
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Fast! Quiet! Cool!
customer_reviews.text: This system runs quiet and cool. Everything I currently play looks fabulous, and I hold a steady 60fps. This is my new streaming rig, and I couldn’t be happier. If Omen keeps these prices, I might stick with this brand every upgrade. Oh... handy feature: go into your Omen dashboard thing. In advanced you can adjust your led lights to scale through a spectrum of your choice to give visual feedback towards CPU or GPU temps. Gives you a nice warm/fuzzy at a glance that its running cool.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E Hart

customer_reviews.title: you will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I got a great deal on this pc. its everything you could ask for except that its pre built and parts are not interchangeable if you want to switch something. I really like that the graphics cards intelligence. It clips all of your game highlights automatically or you can clip gameplay at lengths of 5 minutes. Youre never going to use all the RAM and theres plenty of storage for what i use it for (games/spotify)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bundle and does it all worth what I paid for it but would not pay over 1900 for this build.
customer_reviews.text: Alot of red tape around McAfee and omen software, case has a weird layout and sub optimal airflow. Other than that it does the job and will play any games out there to date.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Worth each penny..
customer_reviews.text: Amazing monitor, 250+ FPS on Fortnite and other games work great like Valorant and COD War Zone.
customer_reviews.author: Fahad

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the cost
customer_reviews.text: runs the high end games smoothly. Great features with the command center. Overall a fantastic buy. Just be sure to raise the bottom of the tower to allow air to flow.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Ignore other negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: This PC rocks. It can handle almost anything you throw at it, and I have not made this thing even come close to overheating. The fan is NOT that loud. If you do manage to make this thing heat up you can change the fan settings to compensate. Absolute beast PC. I don't have to wait for anything.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great and fast computer
customer_reviews.text: Great and fast computer meets all my requirements and then some.. why only 4 stars, can get rather noisy when the fans kick in.. (Video Processing) but it does cut the encoding from 3hr to about 20 min so I can put up with the noise!
customer_reviews.author: Peter J

customer_reviews.title: Immediate bios failure- zero customer service help
customer_reviews.text: Awful awful awful move on. I know everything about this is tempting but save yourself the headache. I booted it up for the first time and immediately had a BIOS failure. Customer service but beyond awful and their website was inaccurate and out of date. Move on from this company and brand
customer_reviews.author: Xavier

customer_reviews.title: Overheats quickly
customer_reviews.text: Need to put in another $80-$100 to ensure it wont overheat. I got the blue screen of death twice, 2nd time was more fatal. Currently requesting a replacement as well as buying a proper cooling system, thermal paste, etc.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Fine tuned machine
customer_reviews.text: Easy to overclock. I added another nvme ssd drive and boost ram to 64 mgs. The default settings are at lowest. I downloaded EVGA Precision X1 to monitor the RTX 2080 super gpu. Omen Command center should expand their options for more gpu control. Its a great computer. Running flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty awesome
customer_reviews.text: 1) it won’t shutdown properly 2) it will play anything 3) I’d own 3 if I wasn’t a total wus.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Had a flaw but great service
customer_reviews.text: Great computer. I would have given five stars but I had the overhearing problem. I contacted HP support and they couldnt have been more helpful. They had me overnight air to repair center ( which they arranged and paid for). I had computer back in four days fixed and working great. I run the new flight sim 2020 on it and it handles flawlessly at full settings. Amazing graphics.
customer_reviews.author: Phw

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, really really noisy
customer_reviews.text: This machine is so loud that it ruins any enjoyment of it and makes any review I write very biased.
customer_reviews.author: blv

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet, fast machine. Tired of building our own and just wanted to click pay and play!
customer_reviews.author: Jpot

customer_reviews.title: Get a useable computer
customer_reviews.text: Doest have an s.d card slot no disc tray so basically it's a pile of crap that's only useable for video games
customer_reviews.author: monte mason

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: The SSD and 32GB memory is all that you need for gaming...
customer_reviews.author: Frank K

customer_reviews.title: Very Solid Machine
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about a month now. The 2080 Super are capable of handling just about anything. No complaints with the graphics. Boots fast, loads fast. Have had the blue screen a couple of times when trying overclocking using both the intelligent function or manual. All in all, a very solid machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great computer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great computer for the price. The only problem is that the processor has thermal problems. I installed MSI afterburner to increase the GPU fan speed and changed the thermal paste. Now the CPU is overclocked (4.89 MHz i9 9900k) and Temps are under control. I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Edward mendez

customer_reviews.title: Gpu is not working properly. Screen randomly stops working and flashes black screen.
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I received this unit the gpu will cut out and my monitor will start flashing. I only have 1 at 144 hz and the other at 60 hz with display port cables. I feel like this gpu is defective. I don't think anyone should buy a 2080 cos the 30's are so much less expensive. This is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Buscay

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and lightning fast
customer_reviews.text: This is something I've always wanted. Already built PC that's lightning fast and doesn't slow down after a few months of use. I know now anything under $800 isn't worth it. It will do everything.
customer_reviews.author: Edson Flamenco

customer_reviews.title: Very slow, no tech-support or warranty
customer_reviews.text: Very slow and freezes up. Tech-support is no tech support. Sucks
customer_reviews.author: LORRI

customer_reviews.title: Great Specs, lacks in cooling
customer_reviews.text: Great specs for this desktop, but the cooling is pretty bad. Had to replace the cooling with a corsair part and sat a extra fan at the bottom of the case for better cooling. I love the computer since the small upgrades I added! It only cost me another 100$ or so for the extra parts so not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Coopaq

customer_reviews.title: Everything is fine until you need a warranty repair...
customer_reviews.text: PC works fine for the most part. I'm 7 months in and the top cooling fan died on me. No big deal. I contact tech support and we verify the computer is still under warranty. They want me to ship the entire PC out for a simple repair such as a fan replacement. They offer no alternative solutions.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Solid Gaming Computer
customer_reviews.text: I've got two of these boxes and the boys love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing but poor cooling
customer_reviews.text: Cheap due to poor cooling. Get a better case. Other than that I picked this up on cyber Monday for about $1500 so beyond worth the money. Even what it's priced now it's still a killer deal.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Butler

customer_reviews.title: Damaged shipment on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Received the delivery with graphic card dislodged from bracket. While in transit the dislodged graphic card scratched the motherboard some and also broke off a part to the motherboard, a capacitor I believe. Sending it back for an exchange hopefully I won’t have to go through this again, fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan heinzman

customer_reviews.title: Bundles should not only be a deal but compatible 🤬
customer_reviews.text: Why would you bundle Corsair Hydro Series H60 AIO Liquid CPU Cooler, 120mm Radiator, 120mm SP Series PWM Fan with this Omen by HP Obelisk Gaming computer if it is not compatible with the cooler🤬
customer_reviews.author: Christina Pawlosky

customer_reviews.title: Great First Pc
customer_reviews.text: This PC is a monster and it is my first pc and it is great for gaming. Overall amazing computer. regarding the overheating I play games like GTA and COD warzone that require lots of requirements and this pc only gets a little warm. Nothing over the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Sori

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this computer, it was a definite upgrade and runs all the games i want on high settings. Definitely worth compared to upgrading to a 2.5 or 3k computer for slightly faster running
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Quality pre-built gaming pc
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Got it for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and runs it on max settings. Haven't had it long but so far so good. Wasn't cheap but it feels like a high quality, well made machine.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Vezina

customer_reviews.title: Great powerful little system and price rocks.
customer_reviews.text: Great PC build and great price. Not getting heating issues like others reported.
customer_reviews.author: Andy De La Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Great computer
customer_reviews.text: For the money, physically cant get a better deal. I run Rust at almost max settings and get 100 frames while recording, not even a stutter. Love this thing worth the buy
customer_reviews.author: Colton

customer_reviews.title: what’s not to love
customer_reviews.text: love this computer. it’s fast, it was a great deal on black friday 2019, and it’s a medium sized case. Looks great on my desk!
customer_reviews.author: demri

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal
customer_reviews.text: For the specs it has, I haven't seen any other prebuilt PC coming close to the price. Looks great and runs amazingly!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Chan

customer_reviews.title: Hard drive issues within 30 days
customer_reviews.text: Hard drive crashed within 1 month. Had to ship off to HP. Been very inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Wise

customer_reviews.title: Not a rtx super
customer_reviews.text: Good computer, but it’s not a rtx super. It’s a regular one. Advertised as super but even specs say it’s not.
customer_reviews.author: Kyong Mcguire

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great! Runs all my VR games at highest graphic quality.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cavadel

customer_reviews.title: Beast of a machine
customer_reviews.text: For the moneys you can’t beat it. Don’t think twice go ahead and click buy now!
customer_reviews.author: caseym

customer_reviews.title: Overheats and Crashes
customer_reviews.text: This PC would constantly crash and overheat. Wasn’t worth the headache of returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck no issues
customer_reviews.text: Great desktop for the money and has great performance. Love the upgrade
customer_reviews.author: Jon-Luke McAdams

product_meta.title: Omen by HP Obelisk Gaming Desktop Computer, 9th Generation Intel Core i9-9900K Processor, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 SUPER 8 GB, HyperX 32 GB RAM, 1 TB SSD, VR Ready, Windows 10 Home (875-1023, Black)
product_meta.description: Style:ComputerThe OMEN 875-1023 is geared with the industry's latest hardware, so you can crush the most demanding games, including Fortnite, PUBG, Overwatch, and Apex Legends. Thanks to real-time ray-tracing technologies in the NVIDIA(R) GeForce(R) RTX 2080 SUPER(TM) graphics, and the performance of a 9th Generation Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-9900K processor, you can achieve new levels of gaming realism, speed, power efficiency, and immersion. Connect your surround sound speakers, or plug your headset into the DTS Headphone: X jack, for an audio experience with more nuanced, immersive sound quality. And turn up your performance even more with included HP OMEN Command Center software that enables control over your CPU overclocking settings and prioritizes your gaming traffic to minimize latency. Featuring a tool-less door for quick access and maintenance, the OMEN Obelisk Desktop 875-1023 is easy to upgrade. When you need to get inside the system, the angled design makes it a breeze to open using the included double-sided screwdriver and replacement screws. With support for micro-ATX motherboard builds, and space for up to three storage devices, your aftermarket parts are sure to fit. When you’ve tricked out your rig just the way you like, show it off with the clear side panel and customizable internal lighting.
feature_bullets: Hyper-realistic graphics: NVIDIA(R) GeForce(R) RTX 2080 Super (8 GB GDDR6 dedicated memory). Enjoy new levels of gaming realism, speed, power efficiency and immersion with real-time ray-tracing technologies
Cutting-edge gaming performance: Geared with the latest hardware and easy to upgrade, so you can crush the latest and most demanding games including Fortnite, PUBG, and Overwatch
Ultra-fast processor: 9th generation Intel Core i9-9900K Processor, 8-core, 3.60 GHz

HP OMEN command center: Included software lets you customize RGB lighting, prioritize gaming network traffic, and stream your PC games on your big screen TV with OMEN game stream (a free remote gaming service)

Solid state drive and memory: 1 TB PCIe(R) NVMe(TM) M.2 Solid State Drive and HyperX(R) 32 GB DDR4-2666 SDRAM (upgradable to 64 GB). Load up your favorite games in seconds, transfer files without waiting hours, and enjoy a more powerful and immersive experience than a standard hard drive
VR ready: Immerse yourself in your favorite virtual reality worlds, such as Skyworld (Note: Does not come with a VR headset)
Tempered glass side panel: Provides a window into your PC’s internal components
Keyboard and mouse: Comes with the HP black wired keyboard with volume control and wired optical mouse

Ports: Headphone/Microphone Combo, Microphone jack, 2 USB 3.1 Gen 1 (top), 4 USB 3.1 Gen 1 (rear), 1 USB 3.1 Gen 2 (rear), 1 USB 3.1 Gen 2 Type-C(TM) (rear), HDMI, 3 DisplayPort(TM), and 10/100/1000 Base-T Network
Operating system and warranty: Windows 10 Home and one-year limited warranty with 24-hour

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars337 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
